<h2>üëã About Me</h2>

<div class="about-card">
<p>
I am currently working in the tech industry, focusing on machine learning, artificial intelligence, large language models, and recommendation systems. I am passionate about developing robust and efficient algorithms that can handle real-world challenges in machine learning.
</p>
<p>
I obtained my Ph.D. in <a href="https://www.cis.upenn.edu/" target="_blank">Computer and Information Science</a> from the <a href="https://www.upenn.edu/" target="_blank">University of Pennsylvania</a>, where I worked on statistical machine learning for complex classification problems. My research focused on learning from noisy labels, multi-label classification, and optimizing non-decomposable performance measures.
</p>
<p>
Prior to my Ph.D., I completed my undergraduate studies at the <a href="https://umich.edu/" target="_blank">University of Michigan</a>, where I earned degrees in Honors Mathematics, Honors Statistics, Computer Science, and Data Science.
</p>
</div>

<div class="about-section">
<h2>üî¨ Research Interests</h2>

<div class="about-card">
<p>My research focuses on <strong>statistical machine learning</strong> for complex classification problems, with particular emphasis on:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Learning from Noisy Labels</strong>: Designing algorithms that can learn good classifiers despite noisy training data, for both multiclass and multi-label learning problems</li>
<li><strong>Multi-Label Classification & Label Ranking</strong>: Developing effective learning algorithms for multi-label losses and various label ranking metrics</li>
<li><strong>Non-decomposable Performance Measures</strong>: Optimizing complex performance measures (F1, AUC, etc.) that cannot be decomposed per example</li>
<li><strong>Weakly Supervised Learning</strong>: Learning from missing or partial labels, and transfer learning</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
